fields.description: use static list of metrics for instances and listMetrics API for grabbing relevant custom metrics.
fields.summary: when creating alarm, use static list of metrics

comments.body:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1879

To test, create a new instance, navigate to instance's monitoring page and open the create alarm dialog.  See appropriate metrics in drop-down.

Thanks!

looks awesome, [~ashamblin]! One small thing:

In user-facing things like dropdown lists, I always try and make the options human-friendly, like using spaces instead of camel case or underscores, and some formatting stuff. If you look at https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Create+alarm you'll see that what's specified in the dropdown for instance metrics is like that. Could you please update the items in the dropdown list to reflect what's in the wireframe? Looking great otherwise!
[~jloza]: This ticket is blocking 3 of my tickets, so the sooner you can (re-)review this the better.
Sorry, man, not picking on you, but these aren't the same as, or in the same order as, the wireframe shows. Back to you.

[~ashamblin]: It seems we don't have much control over the ordering of the metrics list if we use ListMetrics for the entire metrics options list.  I wonder if we could always use our static list to control the order, and use ListMetrics to append any custom metrics to the list, per what's noted in the description?  Thoughts?
[~ashamblin]: Just a heads up that I pushed a couple of minor fixes for the statistic choices to the GUI-2505 branch, so you may want to pull before resuming work on this ticket.

[~jloza] Understood.  I'm trying to work with existing code for these labels, and there is conflict in the console code.  There is a ticket, GUI-2493, in to reconcile these.  We can chase these down in short order.

[~kgill] This ticket should not be blocking anything, as it does not prevent the integration of the create alarm modal.

[~ashamblin]: I've already integrated the create alarm dialog on the resource pages for GUI-2408, 2409, and 2410, but this ticket is blocking me from passing 2408 and 2410 to UX review.  For 2409 I'll need to modify the dialog to allow multiple namespaces to be passed to handle the case where a scaling group has an ELB.
I've updated labels and added order.  Please verify?

can't really verify order until the create alarm dialog can be launched for all resources. Checked PR and names look good, I think. I'll open bugs later if anything else is needed.

Let's pass this one on to code review for now and assume all is well! 

Nice work, [~ashamblin]!

[~jloza]: Just a heads up the "status check failed" metrics ordering doesn't match the wireframe, and the field becomes blank when selecting a metric.  Tested in the Create Alarm dialog on the Instance Monitoring page.

Hi [~ashamblin], punting this one back, somethign strange is going on where when I select a metric from the dropdown the field goes blank (as does that section of the name field), can you check and see what's going on there?

Also, [~kgill] is right, the last two items in the instance metric list are flipped, sorry I didn't notice that, can you fix that too please?
Ok, I think I have it this time!

verified this works on instance landing page. On other landing pages, please ensure metrics are ordered and named that name as the wireframe for create alarm shows. 

UX review passed, ready for code review.

Testing GUI-2410 demonstrates that fetching all metrics via the listMetrics API is unreliable.  See screenshot for an example where an ELB has CW data, but only for the healthy/unhealthy host counts. As the other metrics don't have data, only the healthy/unhealthy host metrics are populated in the create alarm dialog (and populated twice due to multiple dimensions).  Will convert to a static list of metrics as spec'd by this ticket's title/description.

Capturing implementation notes from an IRC discussion earlier today...

Implementation plan...
1. Use static list of metrics to build metrics list
2. Allow one or more namespaces to be passed to filter static list of metrics (which helps address multi-namespace lists required for GUI-2409)
3. Use listMetrics to fetch all metrics, filtering out any metric with a namespace that begins with 'AWS/', leaving only custom metrics as those are not allowed to have a namespace that begins with 'AWS/', per the following note from http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/APIReference/API_PutMetricData.html ...

{code}
You cannot specify a namespace that begins with "AWS/". Namespaces that begin with "AWS/" are reserved for other Amazon Web Services products that send metrics to Amazon CloudWatch.
{code}

Due to pending major changes to create-alarm.js in GUI-2466 I had to back out my changes to that file here (see https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/6299642d74eea349dea1a885).  This ticket is now blocked by GUI-2466

Please verify static list of metrics for create alarm dialog on instance, volume, and ELB monitoring pages.  The metrics list in the dialog for an autoscaling group is tracked in GUI-2409 (to be done after this ticket is reviewed/merged).

To view a custom metric, see https://localhost/instances/i-69936c11/monitoring using acct-02/admin on the latest dev cloud.

PR is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1890
UX review passed, yay! Ready for code review.
[~kgill] How can I test this?

[~alice]: This ticket is in the context of creating an alarm on a particular resource's Monitoring page (e.g. Instance Details page Monitoring tab).  When creating an alarm there, ensure the metrics list includes all relevant metrics for the given resource rather than only a subset of the list (as seen on the metrics landing page).  See https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/master/eucaconsole/constants/cloudwatch.py#L34-L71 for the definitive list of metrics choices based on the namespace.  Creating an alarm for an instance should display the metric choices for the AWS/EC2 namespace, in addition to any custom metrics for that resource (note that custom metrics are tracked in a distinct story).
